alert.note: Alert for Logan County; Morgan County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 22 at 7:51PM MDT until June 27 at 9:37AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Denver CO has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Logan County, Washington County and Morgan County zones. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO LATE TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...South Platte River near Balzac. * WHEN...From late Friday night to late Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, There is extensive flooding of agricultural land near the river. Water flows over State Highway 63 near Atwood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

area.areaDesc: Logan County; Morgan County; Washington County
